name: 33 ACRES OF OCEAN
info: West Coast Pale ale

This is a full flavoured beer integrated with a distinct floral hop which gives it a quality unique to our Pacific Northwest surroundings. This style is evolutionary from a typical IPA with an assertive hop, lower alcohol content, and slight pine aroma. Low in malt character, this beer has a refined quality and a refreshing temperament.

name: SMOOTH CRIMINAL
info: Dry Irish Stout
Begins with a rich roasted malt and light espresso aroma followed by milk chocolate and sweet malt character.

name: LIGHTS OUT STOUT
info: A smooth, creamy, sinfully delicious stout that will satisfy your chocolate and coffee craving.

name: N2 SERIES MILK STOUT
info: The first in Parallel's N2 Series, a series that pays tribute to all things nitro. This beer is brewed as a smooth tasting stout and sweetened using milk sugar (lactose).

name: NITRO OATMEAL STOUT
info: The use of oatmeal in the mashtun adds a silkiness to the texture and body of this ale.

name: HOUSE CIDER
info: A lighter, sweeter version of a traditional cider, but still very dry.

name: SCRUMPY
info: If you're a Scotch drinker, try this one. Scrumpy is strong and sharp, and rich in flavour of BC crab apples fermented without sugar. Once you acquire a taste for Scrumpy, nothing else will do! In old England, scrumpy was a cider made by farm workers who stole or ‘scrumped’ apples from the orchard. Served as a 310mL pour.

name: TRADITIONAL CIDER
info: Winner at Bath & West Show and at the International Cider and Perry Competition. Merridale cider is light, dry and effervescent. It appeals to true cider connoisseurs, and has been called “the best English-style cider in Canada” by wine expert Jurgen Gothe.

name: FILTHY DIRTY WEST COAST
info: A west coast IPA with a ton of hop flavour and aroma. Subtle sweet malt flavour backs up the huge amount of orange, grapefruit, pine and floral aromas this beer expels.

name: 33 ACRES OF DARKNESS SCHWARZBIER
info: A black lager with sweet cocoa aromas. And a dry finish that's loaded with bitter chocolate and black coffee flavours.

name: HOPARAZZI
info: Inspired by the West Coast IPAs, this pale gold lager is loaded with Pacific West Coast hops with a touch of crystal malt. This beer is fermented cool to keep the beer crisp and refreshing as well as dry-hopped to increase the citrusy hop aroma.

name: PILSNER
info: Imported Czech Saaz hops provide the floral aroma and finish to our refreshing and clean drinking lager.

name: SPCA
info: Smoked malt and home smoked hops are used to give this light, crisp unfiltered wheat ale a hint of smokiness. Partial proceeds of all sales go back to the BC-SPCA!

name: 33 ACRES OF NIRVANA
info: Most are very familiar with IPA styles by now. This one is higher in alcohol, which puts it on the lower side of a double IPA category. The IPA is a little darker, and the dominant hop character is grapefruit and orange.

name: FAT TUG IPA
info: A northwest style India Pale Ale that is characterized by an intense hop profile of grapefruit & melon and restrained malt notes.

name: THE IMMORTAL IPA
info: A Northwest interpretation of a classic English style, golden copper in color and loaded with New World hop flavor and aroma. Extremely drinkable.

name: IPA
info: Hop, hops, and more hops! This ale has an intense aroma and a long lingering finish. A beer for the connoisseur, this is the Brewmasters choice.

name: HOPERATION TRIPEL CROSS
info: This IPA slams hop first into a classic belgian yeast to create a super fortress of flavour.

name: HOPDEMONIUM IPA
info: This Pacific Northwest IPA is packed with so many hops it was hard to keep them all in the kettle. They have counterbalanced the intense floral, piney, and citrus hop profile with a strong malt base, giving this ale a wonderful golden colour.

name: ALE
info: A blend of premium Belgian malts, plus German and Pacific Northwest hop varieties gives this luscious, copper-hued ale a wonderful complex aroma, a rich depth of flavour, and smooth drinkability.

name: ESB
info: Honouring the classic British ESB, and celebrating the innovations of the Yakima Valley, this ESB seamlessly blends BC-grown barley and the crystal malts of Great Britain with North America's most aromatic hops.
